unnormalised: The Income Tax Department has announced the deadline for filing ITR for AY 2024-25 is July 31, 2024. Taxpayers are urged to file their returns well in advance to avoid any last-minute rush and potential penalties under section 234F.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has announced the deadline for filing I-T-R for A-Y two thousand twenty four two thousand twenty five is thirty first July two thousand twenty four. Taxpayers are urged to file their returns well in advance to avoid any last-minute rush and potential penalties under section two hundred and thirty four F.

unnormalised: Experts at SBI Capital Markets suggest verifying Form 26AS and AIS for accurate reporting of income. Failure to disclose complete income can result in notices from the department. Individuals with income exceeding Rs. 2.5 lakh are required to file their ITR.
normalised: Experts at S-B-I Capital Markets suggest verifying Form twenty six A-S and A-I-S for accurate reporting of income. Failure to disclose complete income can result in notices from the department. Individuals with income exceeding rupees two point five lakh are required to file their I-T-R.

unnormalised: The process for e-filing is available on the official website incometax.gov.in. Assistance is also available at local tax help centers and through authorized tax return preparers (TRPs).
normalised: The process for e-filing is available on the official website incometax dot gov dot in. Assistance is also available at local tax help centers and through authorized tax return preparers (T-R-Ps).

unnormalised: CBDT officials remind citizens that late filing fees can range from Rs. 1000 to Rs. 5000, depending on the total income.
normalised: C-B-D-T officials remind citizens that late filing fees can range from rupees one thousand to rupees five thousand, depending on the total income.
